Description: Green glazed composition discus fragment with a convex face and flat back, from a mould-made lamp, cut down into a roundel and the edges smoothed: Victoria's shield from a New Year lamp, impressed with a Latin inscription. Possibly made in antiquity as a gaming-piece, or perhaps cut down by a modern dealer to make a fragment into a more saleable object. Buff clay, unslipped. Probably an Italian fabric.
Curator's comments: Compare Heres, G., 1972. ‘Die römischen Bildlampen der Berliner Antiken-Sammlung’. Berlin : Akademie-Verl, No. 606.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (957 bis)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
